.NET Framework 3.5.name: VRTK_BasePointer
.NET Framework 3.5.summary: This abstract class provides any game pointer the ability to know the state of the implemented pointer.
.NET Framework 3.5.remarks:
It extends the VRTK_DestinationMarker to allow for destination events to be emitted when the pointer cursor collides with objects.

 As this is an abstract class, it cannot be applied directly to a game object and performs no logic.

methods.name: AttemptSetController()
CanActivate()
methods.summary: The CanActivate method checks to see if the pointer can be activated as long as the activation delay timer is zero.
methods.returns: Is true if the pointer is able to be activated due to the activation delay timer being zero.

ToggleBeam(bool state)
methods.summary: The ToggleBeam method allows the pointer beam to be toggled on or off via code at runtime. If true is passed as the state then the beam is activated, if false then the beam is deactivated.

params.value: The state of whether to enable or disable the beam.
